allow:
Bash(git commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
Implement sequential rate limiting for Spotify playlist creation

The root cause of rate limiting errors was Promise.all\(\) in playlist creation
composables, which fired hundreds of API requests concurrently during track
matching. Now using sequential processing with 150ms delays between track
matches, reducing request rate to ~6.7 req/sec \(well below Spotify''s limits\).

Changes:
- Replace Promise.all\(\) with sequential for-loops in both createPlaylist functions
- Add 150ms delay between track matches \(applies to both API searches and indexed lookups\)
- Increase batch request delay from 300ms to 1000ms as additional safeguard
- Remove redundant delay logic from matchTracks utility \(now handled at composable level\)

This approach ensures the application respects Spotify''s rate limits for both
mega-playlists and individual playlist imports.

ðŸ¤– Generated with [Claude Code]\(https://claude.com/claude-code\)

Co-Authored-By: Claude Haiku 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")
